issue: Peak brake pressure of 9.5% is below GR86 threshold capability (90%+ with race ABS and Alcon brakes).
action: Critical: Increase peak braking force by 15% at Turn 1/2 chicane. The GR86 race ABS allows 90-95% pressure without lock-up. Build confidence progressively.

issue: Only 0.0% of lap at full throttle. GR86 requires 55%+ due to lower power output.
action: Critical: Reach 100% throttle 55% earlier. Focus on Turn 2 exit and Turn 5 exit. Every meter earlier = 0.05s gained on main straight.

issue: Throttle application 10.1% below best lap average.
action: Apply throttle at apex of Turn 3 and Turn 4. Target: 50% at apex, 75% at mid-exit, 100% at track-out. Current: 64.6%, Target: 74.7%.

issue: Throttle variance of ±19.1% indicates inconsistent corner exits.
action: Standardize throttle application points. Use apex curbing as reference for initial 50% application. Smooth progression is critical.

issue: Longitudinal acceleration of 0.01g is below GR86 capability on slicks.
action: The GR86 torque curve allows aggressive application from 3700 RPM. If losing traction at Turn 2 exit, reduce initial rate by 10%. If no traction loss, increase aggression by 20%.

issue: Average speed 12.7 km/h below your best lap (127.0 vs 139.7 km/h)
action: Focus on minimum corner speeds. Every 1 km/h gained through corners = 0.08s per lap. Target: 139.7 km/h average.

issue: Top speed of 139.8 km/h suggests exit speed or straight-line issues
action: Focus on corner exit acceleration. Better exits = higher top speeds. Also check if you're short-shifting.

issue: Shifting at 6433 RPM. GR86 optimal shift point is 7100 RPM.
action: Shift 667 RPM later on main straight and Turn 2 exit. Use shift light as reference. Power curve remains strong to 7100 RPM.

issue: Lateral G-force of 0.20g is 0.80g below GR86 capability on slicks (1.0g threshold).
action: Critical: Increase corner entry speed by 5 km/h at Turn 3 and Turn 4. Build confidence progressively over 3 sessions. The GR86 on slicks can sustain 1.0g+ in steady-state cornering.

issue: Exit acceleration of 0.01g is below GR86 potential.
action: Critical: Apply 50% throttle at Turn 2 apex, building to 100% by track-out. The GR86 requires aggressive exits to compensate for lower power. Every 0.1g improvement = 0.15s per lap.

issue: Combined throttle (±19.1%) and speed (±19.9 km/h) variance indicates inconsistent apex positioning.
action: Standardize apex points at Turn 3 and Turn 4. Use inside curbing as reference. Consistent apex = consistent exit = consistent lap times.

issue: Input variance (Speed: ±19.9 km/h, Throttle: ±19.1%) is the primary performance limiter.
action: Mandatory: Establish 3 reference points per corner - brake marker (100m board), turn-in point (apex curbing), throttle point (track-out). Consistency is the foundation of speed. All other improvements are meaningless without this.

issue: Abrupt input changes detected (Throttle: ±19.1%, Brake: ±2.0%).
action: Practice progressive inputs. Throttle: 0% to 100% over 1.5 seconds. Brake: 100% to 0% over 1.0 second. Smooth inputs = predictable car behavior.

issue: G-force profile (Longitudinal: 0.01g, Lateral: 0.20g) suggests conservative weight transfer.
action: Opportunity: Brake harder initially at Turn 1 to load front, then smoothly transition to throttle to shift weight rear. This improves rotation and exit traction.

action: Critical: Increase peak braking force by 15% at Turn 1/2 chicane. The GR86 race ABS allows 90-95% pressure without lock-up. Build confidence progressively.

action: Standardize apex points at Turn 3 and Turn 4. Use inside curbing as reference. Consistent apex = consistent exit = consistent lap times.

issue: Input variance (Speed: ±18.4 km/h, Throttle: ±18.5%) is the primary performance limiter.
action: Mandatory: Establish 3 reference points per corner - brake marker (100m board), turn-in point (apex curbing), throttle point (track-out). Consistency is the foundation of speed. All other improvements are meaningless without this.

issue: Abrupt input changes detected (Throttle: ±18.5%, Brake: ±2.0%).
action: Practice progressive inputs. Throttle: 0% to 100% over 1.5 seconds. Brake: 100% to 0% over 1.0 second. Smooth inputs = predictable car behavior.

issue: G-force profile (Longitudinal: -0.00g, Lateral: 0.20g) suggests conservative weight transfer.
action: Opportunity: Brake harder initially at Turn 1 to load front, then smoothly transition to throttle to shift weight rear. This improves rotation and exit traction.
